byline.contributor: J. David Goodman and Colin Moynihan contributed reporting.

abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation agents arrest Alex Lichtenstein, volunteer safety patrol member, on charges of offering bribes to New York City Police Dept officials to obtain handgun permits; marks first arrest directly linked to Mayor Bill de Blasio's fund-raising activities and NYPD corruption probe.

headline.print_headline: Man Is Charged With Offering Bribes to Officers to Obtain Handgun Permits
headline.main: Man Arrested on Charges of Improperly Obtaining Handgun Licenses

snippet: The arrest of the man, a member of a volunteer security force, is the first to materialize from an inquiry into police corruption and Mayor Bill de Blasio’s campaign fund-raising.
lead_paragraph: The arrest of the man, a member of a volunteer security force, is the first to materialize from an inquiry into police corruption and Mayor Bill de Blasio’s campaign fund-raising.
